Oral administration to pregnant rats during late gestation through lactation did not produce adverse maternal, fetal or neonatal effects at clinically relevant doses
There are no data regarding presence in human milk, effects on breastfed infants, or on milk production/excretion to inform risk to an infant during lactation
A study in lactating rats has shown transfer of drug into milk following oral administration
